newsitem.title: USA: Clinton gives and receives in Massachusetts.
newsitem.headline: Clinton gives and receives in Massachusetts.

text.p: - President Clinton arrived in Massachusetts Saturday bearing election-year gifts for the state and then attended an evening fundraising concert and two receptions that generated $2 million for Democrats.

At Logan Airport, Clinton announced with Massachusetts Sens. Edward Kennedy and John Kerry that the compromise budget deal reached earlier in the day with Congress included $50 million to reactivate the Quincy, Mass., shipyard that was closed several years ago because of an industry downturn.
It also included "important funds" to continue the cleanup of Boston Harbor, said Clinton, after stepping off Marine One after flying from Fall River.

The president said the budget would also provide funds to establish a financial management education center in Southbridge, Mass. for military personnel. The Pentagon would release $5 million for it next week and classes would begin March 1.
Asked if this was election-year pork, Clinton said: "If they didn't have independent merit, it would have been difficult to get them in these times that have been particularly contentious."
"This is not something that just came up overnight tied to the election cycle. This is a multi-year effort," he said.
Clinton attended the concert in the city's new Fleet Center, which replaced the fabled Boston Garden, following a long day of campaigning in Texas, Rhode Island and Massachusetts.
The back-to-the '60s concert lineup included Peter, Paul and Mary, Carly Simon, ex-Eagle Don Henley and Crosby, Stills and Nash.

Officials said the night raised $1 million for the Democratic National Committee and $1 million for Kerry, who is locked in a tough re-election fight with William Weld, the state's Republican governor.
